name.title: The name of the entity. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the abstract or real-world entity. It should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

description.title: A phrase describing the entity.
description.description: A description of the entity and what it represents in the real world.

pluralName.title: The plural name of the entity. Contains no spaces
pluralName.description: The name for a set, group or collection of the entity. NOX will guess the plural if it is not supplied.

icon.title: An icon that distinctly and visually represents the entity.
icon.description: An optional icon that represents the entity as a key or in SVG format. It can be a URI that points to a resource countaining the SVG data.

userInterface.title: Specifies information on displaying the entity on a user interface.
userInterface.description: Provides hints to rendering engines as to how this entity should be managed in the user interface.

isVersioned.title: Whether all changes to this entity is tracked for version and auditing.
isVersioned.description: Indicates to the storage engine that all changes to this entity must be tracked over time. Usually used to time-travel, track or audit an entity's state changes.

tableName.title: Table name in the database to which this entity refers to.
tableName.description: Indicates to the storage engine which table in the database these entity persistence settings apply to.

schema.title: Schema name in the database to which the Table Name applies to.
schema.description: Indicates to the storage engine which schema in the database the entity TableName persistence settings apply to.

create.title: Specifies persistence behaviour related to creating the entity.
create.description: Provides behaviour related to the action of creating an entity, e.g. is the action enabled and whether events are raised when the action is triggered.

read.title: Specifies persistence behaviour related to reading the entity.
read.description: Provides behaviour related to the action of reading an entity, e.g. is the action enabled and whether events are raised when the action is triggered.

update.title: Specifies persistence behaviour related to updating the entity.
update.description: Provides behaviour related to the action of updating an entity, e.g. is the action enabled and whether events are raised when the action is triggered.

delete.title: Specifies persistence behaviour related to deleting the entity.
delete.description: Provides behaviour related to the action of deleting an entity, e.g. is the action enabled, whether events are raised when the action is triggered and soft deletes are used.

persistence.title: Specifies information on storing and retrieving the entity.
persistence.description: Provides hints to the database engine and API as to how this entity should be managed in the persistence store.

name.title: The name of the relationship. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the relationship, usually in the format EntityRelationshipTargetEntity. Eg "CountryHasCapitalCity".

description.title: A phrase describing the relationship with the target entity.
description.description: A phrase that describes the relationship of the form <entity> <phrase> <targetEntity>. Eg. "has capital" like in <Country> <has capital> <City>

relationship.title: The type/cardinality of the relationship.
relationship.description: The cardinality (type) of relationship with the target entity, e.g. OneOrMany, ZeroOrOne, etc.

entity.title: The target entity that relates to this entity.
entity.description: The name of the target entity that this entity relates to.

canNavigate.title: Determines whether this side of the relationship is exposed in the generated code and ODATA endpoints.
canNavigate.description: This boolean controls whether this side of the relationship is exposed in the generated code and ODATA endpoints.

items.title: Defines relationships to other entities.
items.description: Defines one way relationships to other entities. Remember to define the reverse relationship on the target entities.

relationships.title: Defines relationships to other entities.
relationships.description: Defines one way relationships to other entities. Remember to define the reverse relationship on the target entities.

name.title: The name of the relationship. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the relationship, usually in the format EntityRelationshipTargetEntity. Eg "CountryHasCapitalCity".

description.title: A phrase describing the relationship with the target entity.
description.description: A phrase that describes the relationship of the form <entity> <phrase> <targetEntity>. Eg. "has capital" like in <Country> <has capital> <City>

relationship.title: The type/cardinality of the relationship.
relationship.description: The cardinality (type) of relationship with the target entity, e.g. OneOrMany, ZeroOrOne, etc.

entity.title: The target entity that relates to this entity.
entity.description: The name of the target entity that this entity relates to.

canNavigate.title: Determines whether this side of the relationship is exposed in the generated code and ODATA endpoints.
canNavigate.description: This boolean controls whether this side of the relationship is exposed in the generated code and ODATA endpoints.

items.title: Defines owned relationships to another entity.
items.description: Defines relationship to owned entities. This entity will be treated as an aggregate root.

ownedRelationships.title: Defines owned relationships to another entity.
ownedRelationships.description: Defines relationship to owned entities. This entity will be treated as an aggregate root.

name.title: The name of the query. Contains no spaces.
name.description: A descriptive name for the query, usually in the format Get[Entity]by[Grouping]. Eg "GetCountriesByContinent".

description.title: A phrase describing expected output from the domain query.
description.description: A phrase that describes expected result from the query. Eg. "Returns a list of countries for a given continent".

name.title: The name of the attribute. Contains no spaces.
name.description: Assign a descriptive name to the attribute. Should be a singular noun and be unique within a collection of attributes. PascalCase recommended.

description.title: The description of the attribute.
description.description: A descriptive phrase that explains the nature and function of this attribute within a collection.

type.title: The Nox type of this attribute.
type.description: Select the Nox value object type that best represents this attribute and its functional requirements within the domain.

isRequired.title: Is the attribute required? Boolean value.
isRequired.description: Indicates whether this attribute is required within the collection. Defaults to false.

label.title: A descriptive label for this attribute on the user interface.
label.description: The text label rendered on the user interface alongside the NoxTextInput component.

translationId.title: The multi-language translation identifier.
translationId.description: A unique string/key to reference the translations for this attribute for multi-language translations.

widget.title: Widget used to render this attribute on the user interface.
widget.description: The user interface control type that is best suited to render the attribute on the screen.

icon.title: The icon representing the attribute on the user interface.
icon.description: A reference URI to the attribute icon file. Could be a CSS or Mudblazor reference, e.g. '@Icons.Material.Filled.Globe'.

iconPosition.title: The position of the attribute icon on the user interface.
iconPosition.description: The postition of the attribute icon relative to the text input area on the user interface, e.g. begin or end.

inputMask.title: A mask expression used to validate and control text input.
inputMask.description: A string of characters that indicates the format of valid input values. For example '(000) 000-0000' could be used for a seven digit phone number with mandatory area code.

outputMask.title: A mask expression used to validate and control a value's output.
outputMask.description: A string of characters that indicates the format of valid output. Used to handle validation triggers for onSubmit and onChange events of the control.

regex.title: The regular expression against which input is validated.
regex.description: A regex string that indicates the format of valid input. For example '/^(\([0-9]{3}\) |[0-9]{3}-)[0-9]{3}-[0-9]{4}$/gm' could be used for a seven digit phone number with mandatory area code.

pageGroup.title: The user interface PageGroup identifier.
pageGroup.description: Used to associate component with a PageGroup identifier on the user interface.

fieldGroup.title: The user interface FieldGroup identifier.
fieldGroup.description: Used to associate component with a FieldGroup identifier on the user interface.

inputOrder.title: Display/edit focus order within a FieldGroup on a user interface.
inputOrder.description: The order within a group of user interface components (FieldGroup) in which this attribute will receive focus for display or edit purpose.

helpHint.title: Helper text for this component.
helpHint.description: The component default helper text used to aid the understanding of the component function to the user.

errorMessage.title: Validation error message.
errorMessage.description: The default error message displayed when text input validation fails.

userInterface.title: The user interface display options for this attribute.
userInterface.description: Specify how this attribute is rendered on the user interface. Configuration options include label, icon, input/output masks, help hints among other.

isReadonly.title: Is this attribute readonly? Boolean value.
isReadonly.description: Indicates whether this attribute is readonly. Defaults to false.

outputMask.title: A mask expression used to validate and control a value's output.
outputMask.description: A string of characters that indicates the format of valid output. Used to handle validation triggers for onSubmit and onChange events of the control.

regex.title: The regular expression against which input is validated.
regex.description: A regex string that indicates the format of valid input. For example '/^(\([0-9]{3}\) |[0-9]{3}-)[0-9]{3}-[0-9]{4}$/gm' could be used for a seven digit phone number with mandatory area code.

pageGroup.title: The user interface PageGroup identifier.
pageGroup.description: Used to associate component with a PageGroup identifier on the user interface.

fieldGroup.title: The user interface FieldGroup identifier.
fieldGroup.description: Used to associate component with a FieldGroup identifier on the user interface.

inputOrder.title: Display/edit focus order within a FieldGroup on a user interface.
inputOrder.description: The order within a group of user interface components (FieldGroup) in which this attribute will receive focus for display or edit purpose.

helpHint.title: Helper text for this component.
helpHint.description: The component default helper text used to aid the understanding of the component function to the user.

errorMessage.title: Validation error message.
errorMessage.description: The default error message displayed when text input validation fails.

userInterface.title: The user interface display options for this attribute.
userInterface.description: Specify how this attribute is rendered on the user interface. Configuration options include label, icon, input/output masks, help hints among other.

isReadonly.title: Is this attribute readonly? Boolean value.
isReadonly.description: Indicates whether this attribute is readonly. Defaults to false.

items.title: Attributes that describe this entity.
items.description: Define one or more attribute(s) that describes the composition of this domain entity.

attributes.title: Attributes that describe this entity.
attributes.description: Define one or more attribute(s) that describes the composition of this domain entity.

items.title: The entities that describe the domain.
items.description: The collection of entities and their relationships with each other.

entities.title: The entities that describe the domain.
entities.description: The collection of entities and their relationships with each other.

title: Information about the domain including entities and their relationships
description: Contains definitions of entities, their attributes, events, commands and queries.
